Reviews.Title: lightweight powerful
Reviews.Author: Gloria
Reviews.Content: so leightweight. love the processor speed and long battery life.also small enough to fit in my purse. wonderful graphics and bright screen

Reviews.Title: Could bring you back from the dark side !!
Reviews.Author: Hernan H.
Reviews.Content: I'm a macbook air 2013 owner, I've purchased this beauty for my uncle (on behalf of him, not with my money!!)... and when arrives...wow...it`s really beautiful , well crafted, light and the screen is quite bright and colors are full.Brand new after first configuration, it boots in no time, from power off  to login screen...maybe 4 or 5 seconds !!My work sometimes involves some show off, so that`s why i will keep my Air... and the 12 hours battery with the Haswell new chip.I'm pretty sure in no time HP will release a haswell spectre...so, stay tuned...I think it will be difficult to find a prettier ultrabook out there ....

Reviews.Title: Better than expected, and a GREAT VALUE!
Reviews.Author: Joseph Walter
Reviews.Content: It arrived as promised (the NEXT DAY)... and worked beautifully right out of the box.  I did have to go through a lengthy setup process with HP Support (by phone), but they did that mostly by remoting-in to the computer (so that I didn't have to do all that much myself).  The support had mostly to do with installing all of the software updates to the Operating System which had been issued since the computer was first built.At any rate.... once that was all completed it's been running full-tilt for nearly two months with NO issues at all.  Batttery life is really good, and it gives ample warning when the level it getting low.The "form factor" (size) as well as its having a solid-state drive (as opposed to a spinning hard drive), REALLY make it perfect for my mobile lifestyle..  I am far less "afraid" to take it along on a car ride or bumpy subway...It's a KEEPER!

Reviews.Title: Excellent machine
Reviews.Author: Tango Mike Alpha
Reviews.Content: First I want to say that this is my first ultrabook. I am not going to repeat what other reviewers have said but I would just like to say a few things:1. this is by no competition the single fastest devise I ever have. I intentionally say devise since it boots even faster than any of my smart phones, tablets, or even my old but trusty Nokia E63 (not so smart) phone. this includes logging in and connecting to the local WiFi.2. on the downside, there is only a single thing that I wish HP has done right: the activity LEDs. now placing these on the side is not a smart idea since it simply becomes irrelevant. I'm (and other people probably) not going to lean to the side of my laptop each time I want to know if the HDD (SDD) is busy. this should have been placed on top, preferably by the power button where it is always visible.I will update this once something new happens.Update 18/Sep/2013I have two more cons that I discovered from day to day usage:1. The keyboard is not that good. SHIFT sometimes does not register, some keys (nothing particular) also fail to register or register as adjacent keys. Now some might say that this is me typing wrong, believe me this is not the case. Most of the time anyway.2. The touch pad buttons are a joke. right clicking results in left clicking most of the time, so I was forced to use a mouse. this makes the point of carrying and using an ultrabook simply mute. The multi-touch feature is AWESOME though. Zooming, and scrolling have never been easier. Only wish the buttons would work as they're supposed to.I still consider this the best PC experience I've had since upgrading my AMD 100 to Intel Pentiom 233 MMX which is why I just can't bring myself to take another star

Reviews.Title: Extremely disappointed in HP
Reviews.Author: Ok
Reviews.Content: The screen of this laptop is literally about to snap off. The left hinge is snapping off and taking the screen with it. This happened within the first couple months of owning the laptop. On top of all of this several screws have fallen out making clicking of the trackpad shoddy. This is the laptop from hell. Never purchasing another HP product again in my life.Words cannot express how saddened I am how this company treats their customers. All representatives are very rude and disrespectful. It is actually impossible to speak with anybody that can help you. The Philippines transfer me to India, India transfers me to Philippines, Philippines transfer me to California, California transfers me back to executive office in the Philippines. I wish I was making this stuff up. I have spoken to 7 different representatives and they all give me the runaround and I get nowhere.

Reviews.Title: So far so great
Reviews.Author: Casey
Reviews.Content: Hoping this will be much lighter and more convenient for this up coming school year. I have bought from hp before and was not impressed so hopefully this one will not be a let down.

Reviews.Title: not bad
Reviews.Author: alexlichao
Reviews.Content: it is a great laptop, much cheaper than thamsong,. i dont like the win8 and changed to win7 with the help from hp, their after sale service is great!

Reviews.Title: Could have a dedicated board
Reviews.Author: Lucas Sampaio Rezende
Reviews.Content: This ultrabook is what i was looking for! Small, thin and fast, but could have a dedicated board althrough integrated

Reviews.Title: Great ultrabook for student
Reviews.Author: Randy Yoneishi
Reviews.Content: I had my previous laptop for a while, so I decided to buy a new laptop.  I go to college and I have to bring my laptop to school often, so I wanted something small and lightweight.  I looked at dell (which was what my previous laptop was), but nothing interested me.  I even looked at a Macbook Air, but then I realized I didn't want a Mac for a computer.  Then I found this Ultrabook and the specs were everything I wanted.  Also, I have never saw a better looking computer than this.  The brushed look is amazing and the light up keyboard is awesome.  Besides the looks, this computer is extremely fast for being so thin.  I haven't done anything that makes this computer lag yet.  The beats audio sounds nice and it can get very loud for an Ultrabook.  Also, for it's purpose of taking it to school, it is so light that I sometimes get scared that I forgot it at home, which is great.Of course, this Ultrabook isn't perfect.  One reason is that the touch pad is sometimes erratic.  Sometimes I try to move the pointer slightly and it jumps to somewhere else.  Also, I don't like when the left and right buttons are attached to the touch pad because sometimes when I am trying to click something, the pointer moves and I miss whatever I am trying to click.  These aren't big problems, but they can be irritating at times.  I use a mouse at almost all times, so it doesn't affect me most of the time.  The other problem is not really the computer's fault, but the computer comes with it.  The problem is of course Windows 8, which is horrible.  I have never used the app mode of Windows 8 because it's useless and more difficult to use, so I just use desktop mode all the time.  The only reason why I keep Windows 8 on this computer is because it is somewhat faster than Windows 7.Besides those small problems, I really love this Ultrabook!

Reviews.Title: great product!
Reviews.Author: ALICIA HAMMOND
Reviews.Content: lightweight, fast and sleek! windows 8 took a little time to get used to, but otherwise, it's a fantastic purchase!

Reviews.Title: Excellent sleep/wake-up times
Reviews.Author: Poulomi Pal
Reviews.Content: Starts up and wakes up within seconds. Easy to get back to work after a break. Very sleek and light as well.

Reviews.Title: Just given a SpectreXT at work
Reviews.Author: Rider
Reviews.Content: I was just handed a SpectreXT to replace my Thinkpad T61p (entierely differet class of machine).  First let's hit the good points.  It is small and light.  It has a solid state drive. It is fast enough for basic tasks. That is about it.1) Crummy low-resolution screen.  Most android phones have higher resolution.  The ONLY way this laptop is useful for productivity work is with external monitors (I added 2). It is bright enough, and viewing angle is decent.2) 4 GB ram soldered in - that is right no upgrade to 8 or 16 GB.3) weak island keyboard - this is true of most recent laptops, but please somebody offer a real keyboard.4) average touchpad with no individual buttons.  I would never buy myself any laptop without a pointer stick in the keyboard, perhaps I'm out of touch, but I find them much easier to use.I would NEVER consider buying one of these.  If I were to consider a laptop with similar features, it would need to be in an 11" size to make it easier to travel with and cost about 1/2 as much, because the value is very poor.

Reviews.Title: HAd to send this junk laptop 2 times foor warranty for a just 4 months old laptop, really bad quality and hardware of HP laptops
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop more or less 4 months ago, and since then I have had to send it to HP warranty service 2 times!!!It's incredible how bad this laptop is considering the price isn't as cheap as other laptops. Many of my friends and siblings have had problems with HP laptops and it was my fault buying from a crappy company.NExt time I will go for a Dell laptop which is better quality than HP very low low standards.Even though they did repeared the laptop as its just 4 months old. I'm kinda afraid this issues are taking time from me and money since I have to pay for boxes and take the laptop to the delivery service.HP I hope you read this: I'm never ever again going to buy any of your products, and all of my friends told me beware of HP's crappy quality

Reviews.Title: Best PC ever
Reviews.Author: Alan Ogilvie
Reviews.Content: Very slim sleet PC. Bought 1 and 4 weeks after bought another for my daughter in collage. She loves it as ITI is light to carry around.

Reviews.Title: Piece of Junk
Reviews.Author: Unbiased buyer
Reviews.Content: Lid is flimsk and creaks/clicks. Webcam has never worked properly. The few times that it did work it was completely fuzzy with horizontal blue lines running up and down.  It disconnects every time I touch the lid which makes the usb-disconnect warning sound. I had to disable it in the device manager. Did not try to contact HP about the issue. However, Ive been a huge HP fan for many years and this is hugely disappointing. You buy a state-of-the-art laptop for $1000 and you expect it to come with a working webcam. Pure junk. I agree with the other reviewers that the battery isn't quite as expected and that the fan is ridiculously loud. HP dropped the ball on this one.

Reviews.Title: Grounding issue
Reviews.Author: Guillaume Dargaud
Reviews.Content: I will limit this review to two things: Linux and the touchpad.Once I disabled UEFI, I installed Ubuntu 13.04 on the SpectreXT without problem and everything worked out of the box (bluetooth, wifi, webcam...). So that's a good thing.But the touchpad has a grounding issue: if I place a finger on it, unmoving, it jumps all over the place. Add another finger on the plastic body of the laptop and it stops. There must be some trick to fixing this because I don't really want to send it back now that everything is installed as I want. But it's basically unusable without your second hand laying on the base.
